Uses of Interface
fr.upmc.components.ComponentI.ComponentTask

  • Packages that use ComponentI.ComponentTask 
    Package Description
    fr.upmc.components
    Basic component model.

    • Uses of ComponentI.ComponentTask in fr.upmc.components

      Methods in fr.upmc.components with parameters of type ComponentI.ComponentTask 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.concurrent.Future<?> AbstractComponent.runTask(ComponentI.ComponentTask t) 
      java.util.concurrent.Future<?> ComponentI.runTask(ComponentI.ComponentTask t)
      run the component task as main task of the component.
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> AbstractComponent.scheduleTask(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u) 
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> ComponentI.scheduleTask(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a task to be run after a given delay.
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> AbstractComponent.scheduleTaskAtFixedRate(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long initialDelay, long period, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u) 
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> ComponentI.scheduleTaskAtFixedRate(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long initialDelay, long period, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a task that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is executions will commence after initialDelay then initialDelay+period, then initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on.
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> AbstractComponent.scheduleTaskWithFixedDelay(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long initialDelay, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u) 
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> ComponentI.scheduleTaskWithFixedDelay(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long initialDelay, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a task that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next.
